sense.gloss: wisteria (esp. Japanese wisteria, Wisteria floribunda), wistaria

sdata.j: ↑近|藤|↑↓こんどう↓さんは↑会社↑↓かいしゃ↓で↑一番↑↓いちばん↓↑熱心↑↓ねっしん↓に↑働↑↓はたら↓きます。
sdata.e: Mr Kondo is the most hardworking in his company.

sdata.e: We've got to hurry. Mr Itoh will call the roll.

sdata.e: Mr. Kato teaches us English.

sdata.e: Mr Kato, who lives in Paris, misses his family left at home.

sdata.e: Kato asked him many questions about the United States.

sdata.e: Kato's class consists of forty boys and girls.

sdata.e: Mr Kato was too old to work any longer.

sdata.j: ↑加|藤|↑↓かとう↓さんは↑先生↑↓せんせい↓である。
sdata.e: Mr Kato is a teacher.

sdata.j: ↑雨↑↓あめ↓が↑降↑↓ふ↓ろうが↑降↑↓ふ↓るまいが、|↑藤|田↑↓ふじた↓はピクニックをしようと↑計画↑↓けいかく↓している。
sdata.e: Whether it rains or not, Fujita is planning to have a picnic.

sdata.e: Miss Ito made her students work hard.

sdata.j: ↑伊|藤|↑↓いとう↓↑太郎↑↓たろう↓は↑有罪↑↓ゆうざい↓と↑判決↑↓はんけつ↓された。

sdata.e: Mr Ito teaches history.

sdata.e: Mr Ito will call the roll.

sdata.e: Mr Ito loosened his tie because he felt hot in his office.

sdata.e: Hello, I'm Tomoko Sato from Japan.

sdata.e: Such poets as Toson and Hakushu are rare.

sdata.e: The news was told to me by Ito.

sdata.e: In 1995, Andou received architecture's most prestigious award.
